questions.text: Oxygen forming the molecule O3 is called:
questions.explanation:
Ozone.

	In the upper atmosphere, naturally-occuring ozone protects the Earth from excess ultra-violet rays.

questions.text: The unstable isotope, O-15, has a half life of about:
Molecular oxygen (O2) comprises what percentage of the Earth's atmosphere (at sea level)?
questions.explanation:
21.

	Air is 78 percent nitrogen, 21 percent oxygen, and 1 percent other gases.

questions.text: What life process of most life forms requires oxygen?
questions.explanation:
respiration.

	It is used to metabolize fuels (fats, sugars) in life forms. Even though plants create O2 in photosynthesis, at night they need to 'burn' some of the fuel they created.
